HelpXML.Title: TBrho
HelpXML.Purpose: TBrho computes rho function for Tukey's biweight

Item.Name: u
Item.LongDesc: n x 1 vector containing residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample

Item.Name: c
Item.LongDesc: Scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator (beta in regression or mu in the location case ...)

Item.Name: rhoTB
Item.TypeInd: Tukey's biweight rho associated to the residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample.

HelpXML.MoreAbout:
function TBrho transforms vector u as follows \[ TBrho(u)= \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} (c^2/6) \left\{ 1-[1-(u/c)^2]^3 \right\} & |u/c| \leq 1 \\ (c^2/6) & |u/c| >1 \\ \end{array} \right. \]
See equation (2.37) p. 29 of Maronna et al. (2006). Remark: equation (2.37) is written in standardized terms in such a way that $\rho(c)=1$, so it is the previous expression divided by $(c^2/6)$

References.Item: Maronna, R.A., Martin D. and Yohai V.J. (2006), Robust Statistics, Theory and Methods, Wiley, New York.
Riani M., Cerioli A., Torti F. (2014). On consistency factors and efficiency of robust S-estimators, TEST, Volume 23, Issue 2, pp 356-387. http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s11749-014-0357-7

Item.MATLABcode: close all x=-6:0.01:6; rhoTB=TBrho(x,2); plot(x,rhoTB,'LineWidth',2) xlabel('$u$','Interpreter','Latex') ylabel('$\rho (u,2)$','Interpreter','Latex') text(x(1)-0.8,rhoTB(1),'c^2/6') text(x(end)+0.2,rhoTB(end),'c^2/6') title('$\rho (u,c)$','Interpreter','Latex') hold('on') c=2; stem(c,c^2/6,'LineStyle',':','LineWidth',1) stem(-c,c^2/6,'LineStyle',':','LineWidth',1)
